decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creatures to assemble specific combinations that allow for powerful synergies and combos. By using cards like Chord of Calling to search for key creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide, players can create powerful board states that can lead to victory. The deck also includes support cards like Wall of Roots and Gilded Goose to ramp up mana production and enable quicker plays. Overall, the main strategy is to efficiently tutor for and deploy creatures that work together to create a winning board presence.

The deck focuses on cycling through cards quickly to fill the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them back onto the battlefield all at once, overwhelming the opponent. It includes cards like Architects of Will and Street Wraith to cycle efficiently, along with cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation for control and protection. The deck also includes creatures like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves to provide additional value when they are brought back with Living End. The key strategy is to set up a massive board presence in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on maximizing the power of multicolor creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Nishoba Brawler and Scion of Draco, along with versatile spells like Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and deal damage rapidly. The inclusion of a companion like Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an additional layer of consistency and synergy to the deck, ensuring that it can operate smoothly and effectively in a competitive Modern 1 vs 1 environment.

This deck focuses on utilizing land triggers from Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal damage to the opponent, especially when combined with cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Freestrider Lookout to enable additional landfall triggers. With the ability to manipulate the top of the library with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Wrenn and Six, the deck can set up combos quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds a versatile element to the deck, allowing for additional mana acceleration and flexibility in gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing efficient and low-cost burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Rift Bolt, Lava Spike, Skewer the Critics, and Searing Blaze. Creature aggression is also a key component with Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Eidolon of the Great Revel providing early pressure. The inclusion of Boros Charm and Skullcrack adds versatility and prevents opponent's life gain. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for spells. Ultimately, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and relentless aggression.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tarmogoyf to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also contains a mix of disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds additional flexibility and consistency to the deck. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and maintain a strong board presence to secure victory in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 matchup.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on keeping opponents' resources in check while building up its own with cards like Cabal Coffers and Karn, the Great Creator. It utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board, along with disruptive cards like Extirpate and Force of Despair. The win condition is to outvalue opponents with cards like March of Wretched Sorrow and Insatiable Avarice, eventually closing out the game with powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End or The Meathook Massacre. The deck also includes some utility lands like Field of Ruin and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to maintain control.
